section.p:
Examples with proper nouns –
Tha Màiri sgìth. Tha i sgìth ag obair anns an achadh.
Mary is tired. She is tired working in the field. td. 7
Tha Calum sgìth: tha e ag obair gu trang anns an achadh.
Malcolm is tired: he is working busily in the field. td. 7

Examples with third person pronouns –
Tha Màiri sgìth. Tha i sgìth ag obair anns an achadh.
Mary is tired. She is tired working in the field. td. 7
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Bha iad glé sgìth nuair a thàinig iad dhachaidh feasgar.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They were very tired when they came home in the evening. td. 76
Their iad gu bheil iad sgìth.
They will say that they are tired. td. 177

Examples with common nouns –
Tha an duine sin sgìth.
That man is tired. td. 79

sgìth [ag] obair tired working –
Tha Màiri sgìth. Tha i sgìth ag obair anns an achadh.
Mary is tired. She is tired working in the field. td. 7
Tha Calum sgìth: tha e ag obair gu trang anns an achadh.
Malcolm is tired: he is working busily in the field. td. 7
Tha sibh trang ag obair anns an achadh agus tha sibh sgìth.
You are busy working in the field and you are tired. td. 7
Tha mi sgìth le obair.
I am tired with work. td. 244

sgìth a’ coiseachd tired walking –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. td. 146

trang agus sgìth busy and tired –
Tha Calum sgìth – tha e ag obair gu trang anns an achadh.
Malcolm is tired – he is working busily in the field. td. 7
Tha sibh trang ag obair anns an achadh agus tha sibh sgìth.
You are busy working in the field and you are tired. td. 7
